result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert R. Rowe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant present with Atty Johnson. 
District Attorney John Snider present. 
15CM49: Complaint received, reading waived, and not guilty plea entered.
Court orders defendant to be booked on 15CM49. 
14CM143: No contest plea on Count 1. 
14CM289: No contest plea on Count 4. 
14CM393: No contest plea on Count 2. 
PLQ filed with the Court. 
Pleas accepted after rights explained and defendant is found guilty. 
14CM289: Counts 1 - 3 dismissed and read in. 
14CM393: Count 1 dismissed and read in. 
14CM394, 14CM463 & 15CM49: Dismissed and read in. 
State is in compliance with victim notifications. 
Statement filed with the Court by DA Snider. 
Recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 2 years probation, each case concurrent. 
Conditions:
- pay costs
- pay supervision fees
- pay domestic abuse surcharge on 14CM143
- pay witness fees
- pay $2997.99 restitution on 14CM289
- pay $299.80 restitution surcharge on 14CM289
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations
- submit to AODA assessment and abide by recommendations
- not possess or consume any alcohol without written approval from Agent
- not engage in any physically assaultive behavior with sister Patricia Rowe
- eligible for early discharge after 1 year, upon application of the Agent
32 days credit on 14CM289 if revoked.
Defendant to report to P&P today. 
Appeal rights explained.
